title: If 'the truth will set you free' what is the truth and what are you set free from? - Quora

response.answer_text: Consider this couple. Everyone knows what she said. Everyone knows what he said. There are claims against him. There was brainwashing involved, perhaps. The myriad details grow and develop like tumors. Years pass. No one is closer to "the truth." Fans put it behind them. They go back to the cinema and see his latest movie. About more liars. More moralistic dilemmas. Year after year. Everyone wants relief from the pain. After some time we look up to find, someone is still lying. Maybe both of them are making up stories in different ways. Children were involved in the entangled destruction of lost hope and love. They spend their precious lives taking sides as adults. Get famous in Vanity Fair. Nobody knows for certain what happened, many years ago, in an attic.   To be set free means to leave the story behind.  It just may be that the world's suffering happens because we choose to remain in a story that we do not want to get rid of, that we do not wish to leave. We are not like Woody Allen characters that can jump out of a movie screen and visit "real life." We are stuck in our stories, in our heads, in our attics. We all have an ongoing schtick that we keep believing about ourselves, the world, and ourselves in relation to the world. Schtick. I love that word. Schtick! Who do you become when you drop the story? When you decide to quit believing in dishonest and twisted accounts of your version of reality?  Lighter. Truer. More yourself.  You are set free from illusion. Enlightenment is just right there. You learn how to see the world, shining and dazzling in its purity with new eyes, with fresh perspective. You become more available for life to breathe through you. You become unstuck. The air around you begins to blow, there is movement. Why is this good?  Because it lightens the load. Heavy people carry many stories, many schticks. You get to know them all because they repeat them over and over. Some carry them to their graves and energetically, force other people to deal with the heaviness at their very own funerals -and beyond.  Truth is light. Lightness is attractive and attracts more light. When you step out of your story, off the screen, you get in touch with the lightness of being. That is worth knowing.  The truth shall set you free. Free means free. Many never get there.

i believe that truth is reality in its most essential form. Perceptions be damned!   Recognizing the truth, I am liberated from the illusion of reality through the senses, I peer deeper into my self, and into the world around me;By seeing that they are one and the same, I am liberated from the conflict of self and other;By being one with reality, I see that I am god, and have become liberated from the bonds of mans law;Discovering my own innate sovereignty, I am at union with godhead, and truly free from conflict. We are one Self. Love and Appreciation

The Truth that will set you free can not be formulated into words. It is not knowledge as all knowledge is of this world. In order to know the Truth you have to be "it". That is why Jesus said I am the Truth and the way.  When you know your true Self (not who you think you are) you will know the Truth and the Truth will set you free from suffering.

I always understood that phrase to mean that the facts usually come out. That it is better to live life honestly, and that false accusations will more than likely become known as such.  By extension, if you have nothing to be false about in the first place, you do not have the burden (prison/ lack of freedom) of maintaining that falsehood. I think it is generally true, but there are many exceptions. My jury is still out on the whole karma concept.
The truth is that lying to yourself will cause more harm than good.  You're set free from the excessive harm that lying to yourself would cause.

For thousands of years we've taught our kids that the world was built by gods who resemble us, on ethical principles that naturally reward good and punish evil, and that faith is good. Surprise, evil usually wins because the good are passively trusting.

At the core of all form of suffering is untruth. Misconceptions, mistakes, concealment, ignorance, erroneous interpretations, and of course, lying. These cause suffering because they act as a barrier to alignment. Not alignment with what, or whom. Just, alignment. The state of being in tune.

Lying, or living a lie, is oppressive and stressful, because you're constantly afraid of being found out. You you're basically in the jail of your lies. When you tell the truth, it sets you free to be yourself again, not to be afraid anymore. Thus: "The truth will set you free". Free from fear, free from worries, free from hiding.

author_info.name: Keinosuke Johan Miyanaga / 宮永 ヨハン 計之介

response.answer_text: From any crooked lies those truths would set straight, in situations where you are constrained or being hampered by lies. Though it can still sound insightful, the statement doesn't apply to any other situation as easily in any concrete or meaningful way.
You have less things to remember when you tell the truth. - Mark Twain. You are set free from all the things you need to remember and which increases exponentially and very quickly.
Silence is the truth that sets you free from yourself.
Knowledge will set you free from truth, when the word truth is used to indicate veracity, and not accuracy.
